result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tashem Chairon Marshall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Tashem Chairon Marshall.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Bail/bond hearing proceeded. Defendant was extradited from Texas; arguments heard by defense and the state. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction. Defense received discovery and offer and requested plea hearing date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (13 pages) commencing 08-10-2022, by Irene Koenigs.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Tate. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tashem Chairon Marshall
Current: 3824 N. 14th St., Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 07-31-2022)
Prior: 3737A North 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Tashem Chairon Marshall not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@2:30p
